member.name: M:Analyze.Daylighting.Illuminance.ByRGB(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Construct an Illuminance data point. Illuminance is the integrated total visible light energy arriving per unit area on a surface from all directions. The data is three colored illuminance value (RGB). Each color is measured in Lux. Lux is a derived unit equal to lumens per square meter.

member.name: M:Analyze.Daylighting.Illuminance.ToSRGB
member.summary: Transform an RGB Illuminance value to the sRGB standard computed as (0.2126 * R + 0.7152 * G + 0.0722 * B). The unit of the returned value is in lux (lumens/m^2)."

member.name: M:Analyze.Daylighting.Illuminance.ToFootCandles(System.Double)
member.summary: Transform a single illuminance value in lux to foot-candles
member.param: An illuminance value in lux
member.returns: The transformed illuminance value in foot-candles

member.param: A SkyModel describing the characteristics of the sky
GPS coordinate in X direction
GPS coordinate in Y direction
The time at which to evaluate (the UTC offset must correspond to the GPS coordinate)
